data.title: Private Jet Charter to Paris, France

data.text:
About Paris, France

Home to world-renowned fashion designers, the often-frequented art museums in the world, as well as the romantic Eiffel Tower, the City of Lights is a choice destination for fashion enthusiasts, culture buffs, and loving couples. Paris is the largest city in France and the fifth largest city in the European Union. Located on the Seine River and in the center of the Île-de-France region, Paris has pleasant summer days and relatively warm winters. Paris is also the economic center of France, and a hub for service and advanced manufacturing industries. The city of Paris is known for its rich culture and is home to the largest fashion houses of the world and, especially, for its world-renowned Michelin-starred restaurants.

Popular Destinations in Paris

Looking for activities once your private jet arrives in Paris? Paris plays host to a plethora of esteemed institutions and places of interest. During your trip to Paris, you may want to visit some of these famous attractions:

Eiffel Tower: Constructed by the engineer Gustave Eiffel for the 1889 World’s Fair, the Eiffel Tower is one of the world’s most recognizable structures, and the most frequented paid monument worldwide. At over 1,000 feet in height, the Eiffel Tower remains the second-tallest structure in France, and is an icon of romance for couples all over the world.

Louvre: The Louvre is one of the world’s largest museums. Established in 1792, the Louvre is home to over 35,000 works of art and 380,000 artifacts, as well as the iconic Louvre Pyramid, which was designed by I. M. Pei in 1982, and serves as the main entrance to the Louvre. The Louvre is also the world’s most visited museum, playing host to over 15,000 visitors a day.

Notre-Dame de Paris: A historic Catholic cathedral in the fourth arrondissement, Notre-Dame de Paris is one of the largest churches in the world, and one of the characteristic examples of French Gothic architecture. Construction of the church began in 1163 under the rule of Louis VII, and the church was eventually completed in 1345. Today, the church remains a focal point for Catholicism in France, and key religious events continue to take place at the church.

Disneyland Paris: Located east of Paris, Disneyland Paris is the most visited theme park in France and in Europe. It is the second Disney resort to open outside of the United States after Tokyo Disney Resort. The resort is home to the famous La Château de la Belle au Bois Dormant (The Castle of the Sleeping Beauty), as well as the theatre show CinéMagique not found at other Disneyland resorts.

Palace of Versailles: A royal château located in the Île-de-France, the Palace of Versailles is one of the largest palaces of the world. It is a symbol for the French royal family before the French Revolution. The Palace of Versailles is home to the Galerie des Glaces (Hall of Mirrors), where numerous ceremonies of the French Court took place, the Museum of the History of France, as well as the Garden of Versailles, which is placed on the UNESCO World Heritage List.

Luxury Lodging in Paris

Seeking luxury accommodations once your private jet has arrived in Paris? Paris visitors will find numerous luxurious and top-tier accommodations, with its wide range of five-star hotels all over the city. Some of these accommodations include:
